content: I was "discharged" in '77 and I was looking on my DD214 recently... In "box #10" there is a space for my spn/spd code...there is a dotted line through it-----. In the remarks section it states "transferred to TDRL". Most of you know that TDRL stands for "temporary disabled retired list". My question is... "Am I still ON the TDRL? Am I still on TDRL, with a stipulation that I am returning to active duty someday? Since I don't have a DD214 that is properly filled out, does that mean my discharge is not in effect? Will I have to get another outgoing physical and DD214"? Any help on this is greatly appreciated.
reply: I was "discharged" in '77 and I was looking on my DD214 recently... In "box #10" there is a space for my spn/spd code...there is a dotted line through it-----. In the remarks section it states "transferred to TDRL". Most of you know that TDRL stands for "temporary disabled retired list". My question is... "Am I still ON the TDRL? Am I still on TDRL, with a stipulation that I am returning to active duty someday? Since I don't have a DD214 that is properly filled out, does that mean my discharge is not in effect? Will I have to get another outgoing physical and DD214"? Any help on this is greatly appreciated.
title: It's about my discharge...

content: Check back a little later and see if someone posts help for you. I will look aaround and see what I can find. MD

title: It's about my discharge...

content: Here is what it means. I wanted to check to be sure there was no other meaning for your code: Temporary Disability Retired List. Where you stand right now is only known by you and VA. You need to contact them and get it straightened out. That we can not help you on. MD
reply: Here is what it means. I wanted to check to be sure there was no other meaning for your code: Temporary Disability Retired List. Where you stand right now is only known by you and VA. You need to contact them and get it straightened out. That we can not help you on. MD
title: It's about my discharge...

content: I’ve found some sites for you. Some may apply for your TDRL. “http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q=regulations+for+temporary+disabled+retired+list&btnG=Google+Search&aq=f&oq=” Military Disability (Medical) Separations and Retirements “http://usmilitary.about.com/od/theorderlyroom/a/medseparation.htm” Understanding Military Retirement Pay “http://usmilitary.about.com/cs/generalpay/a/retirementpay_3.htm” Disability Retirements “http://www.dfas.mil/rna-news/may2007/disabilityretirement.html” PEB board “http://www.pebforum.com/physical-evaluation-board-system-overview/11-tdrl.html” Hadit.com Veterans forum “http://www.hadit.com/forums/lofiversion/index.php/” Hope this helps. Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!
